column1: Concatenation of first author name and year of publication
column3: Brief description of the area of sampling with region- administrative region or province- country
column7: Above sea level altitude of sampling
column9: Identifier of the measurement in the study.
column11: Categorical description of the land cover
column12: Plant species reported in the article.
column13: Climate classification based on Koeppen Geiger classification
column14: Volume of annual precipitation. Most articles donÕt disentangle rain- and snow-fall. Bold values represent sites mean reported in the article
column15: Description of litterfall sampling procedure and period
column16: Description of throughfall sampling procedure and period
column18: Litterfall plant tissues collected; ÒTotalÓ refers to total collected and unsorted litterfall
column20: Annual flux of Hg deposited through litterfall.
column22: Annual flux of MeHg deposited through litterfall.
column24: Concentration of Hg in throughfall weighted by the volume of throughfall. Note that even if this mean is more precise for mass bilan that non weighted-average only two articles explicitly reported mean Hg concentration weighted by throughfall
column25: Annual mean concentration of Hg in throughfall
column26: Annual mean concentration of MeHg in throughfall
column27: Annual mean flux of Hg in open precipitation
column28: Annual mean flux of MeHg in throughfall
column29: Annual mean concentration of MeHg in open precipitation
column30: Annual mean flux of Hg in throughfall
column31: Annual mean flux of MeHg in open precipitation

column9: When provided by the study  it is used directly; otherwise it is constructed using LandType(+_Year) or Tissues(+_Year) in cases where multiple measurement types exist. Each ID corresponds to a single measurement in the study. When study provides only 1 measurement SampleId contains AuthorYear.
